sub_title: Interim Executive & Advisor @ Vivecommerce | Focus on digitally enabled growth strategie and organisational scaling
summary:
With over 15 years of experience in e-commerce, consulting and tech, I am passionate about building and improving businesses in this dynamic and competitive field as Executive or Advisor. I have a proven track record of leading and growing multiple businesses, from strategy development to execution, from incubation to integration, and from local to international expansion.

As an interim executive (CEO/COO/CPO) and advisor, I partner with clients who face complex and multi-faceted challenges, and help them achieve at least a 5-fold return on their investment. I leverage my expertise in e-commerce, retail, and fast-growing businesses, as well as my skills in process improvement, analytical thinking, and business development. I have contributed to scaling the Dutch/Belgium #1 e-commerce company, bol.com, from EUR 250 million to a multi-billion company.
Recently, I was CEO a.i. of the PE-owned umbrella brand for professional powertools and paint e-stores in Europe, Fixami. 
I also dedicate part of my time and income to not-for-profit initiatives that align with my values and goals.

school.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

profile_positions.description: External Advisor to BCG as industry expert on Digital growth strategies, Ecommerce and Retail.
profile_positions.title: External Advisor to Boston Consulting Group (Digital & Ecommerce)

profile_positions.description:
Vivecommerce is specialised in e-commerce, tech, retail and fast growing businesses. Part of our time and income is spend on not for profit initiatives. 

We seek partnerships with our clients with the philosophy that what you invest in us gets at least a 6-fold return. If an assignment does not have that potential, we will not start the engagement. We perform best on multi-faceted challenges, where clarity on root causes are lost. We will help you solve your challenges with your own team or assign you an specific expert.

Our roles include those of Interim Executive, advisor to the board, Industry Expert, and hands-on growth support.
profile_positions.title: Advisor & Interim executive

profile_positions.description:
Fixami is the PE-owned umbrella brand for multiple professional powertools and paint e-stores in Europe. With ~180 employees and >€100mio revenues. 
The brands, among others, include:
➡️ Gereedschapcentrum (.nl)
➡️ Fixami (.be/.fr/.es/.de)
➡️ Verfwebwinkel (.nl/.be)
profile_positions.title: Interim Chief Executive Officer

profile_positions.description:
Bol.com is the leading eCommerce company in the Netherlands & Flanders. 
Together with over 50k local retailers/entrepreneurs they serve >35% of the consumers in the Dutch language area (i.e. >10 million customers). 

My team's role was to incubate new businesses. The incubation period varied from a few months to multiple years. In all cases, we were responsible for the proposition, the business case (and P&L) and (IT) realization.
Example businesses we led and created are: 
- Last-mile innovations and the introduction of Select (bol.com's answer to Amazon Prime)
- Assessing and entering new market(s) (segments). Initially focused on adding new categories and later we launched into the French part of Belgium (Wallonia).  A complex venture, since this was the first non-Dutch region
- Developing retail services for Market-Place Partners. The most prominent example is Logistics via bol.com and "Verzenden via bol.com" in which bol.com (partially) takes-over the last-mile, customer service, warehousing and fulfilment 
- Experimenting with new Tech & Trends (e.g. Voice and Visual Search)
profile_positions.title: Director Strategy & Business Development

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the Market-Place Product and bol.com's proposition to B2B customers. 

Market-Place Product
My team was responsible for the strategy, proposition and business development of bol.com's market place. We balanced customer satisfaction and seller satisfaction while securing ambitious growth targets. Growth not only in revenues, but also in terms of assortment, competitive prices, fast and reliable delivery, best content and retail services. 

Started in 2011 as an experiment, during this period already 1 out of 3 sales on bol.com was Market-Place driven. The rapid growth came with challenges, both on consumers as on the market-palce partners. Our job was to prioritise and solve the issues, while delivering ambitious growth targets. 

Business customers:
We delivered three propositions for business customers: 
1) bol.com gift cards: an ideal surprise for employees, business partners or customers
2) business account for all your business purchases: choose from >15 million products
3) volume discounts
profile_positions.title: Director Marketplace & B2B

profile_positions.description:
In 2015 my team shifted focus from entering new markets to among others: 
- Improving bol.com’s last-mile proposition for consumers (e.g. Sunday delivery, same-day)
- Delivering Marketing & Media services to brands, suppliers and our market place partners
Every project is led by one or several business developers working with a multi-disciplinary project team. 

In this period we launched:
- Marketing & Media Services, which is now set-up as a separate business unit within marketing
- "Tassen & Lederwaren" as our latest product group extension to our luxury category
profile_positions.title: Director Of Business Development

profile_positions.description:
In 2012 a key pillar in bol.com's growth strategy was category expansion into attractive retail markets that were ready for online buying. Often we were the first in the Netherlands and Flanders to offer a significant broad and deep assortment online in these categories. 

As business development team we were responsible for assessing retail markets and launching in the interesting ones. To make this possible we led a multi-disciplinary project team that started small in the strategy phase, but grew to a team of over 60 colleagues in the implementation phase. In essence as business developer I was responsible for:
- market assessment
- consumer proposition
- business case 
- project delivery

As a business developer in this period my projects include:
- Entry into kitchen and house hold goods with ~12k products launched June 2012 (2017: >70k products)
- Entry into DIY, Pets and Garden with ~60k products launched February 2013 (2017: >200k products)
- Proposition relaunch of digital reading through a partnership of bol.com with Kobo launched September 2014 (a.o. this partnership added >2 million International ebooks & seamless buying and reading experience)
- Incubation of an industry initiative LeesID for frictionless buying and reading of ebooks across retailers. Owner of the initiative is CPNB see LeesID.nu for more information.  Launched September 2014 

During this period I promoted from medior to senior business developer and from senior to lead business developer.
profile_positions.title: Business Developer

profile_positions.description:
Advisor for large multinationals, primarily in insurance or banking. Trainer of:
- Communicating with impact (pyramid principle)
- Lean Six Sigma Yellow and Green-Belt

Project experience is diverse and varies from operational excellence, target operating models to growth strategies in emerging markets. Key commonality is a fact-based approach, effective and direct communication and a focus on impact.
profile_positions.title: Advisor
